content.overview: Original stone arches frame an open-plan flow between salon, dining, and chef's kitchen. Outdoor living centers on the private 12.5m pool, sunset terrace, and shaded Moroccan lounge.
content.location: Strategic secluded base in Alignan-du-Vent near Béziers: Mediterranean beaches, historic sites, and vineyards all within easy reach.
content.story: Domaine des Montarels is a centuries-old wine domaine with roots traced to the 10th century. Its original stonework, arches, and beamed ceilings remain, paired with quiet modern comforts for restorative stays. The estate has been lovingly stewarded by your hosts, Ian and Katie Jackson, who focus on privacy, simplicity, and effortless hospitality.

seoLong: This private Languedoc retreat pairs original monastery character — arches, stone, old beams — with modern, silent comfort. It is a calm base near Pézenas and Béziers for beaches, vineyards, and slow travel in the South of France.

Ideal for multigenerational families and close friends, the estate offers generous indoor‑outdoor living, a heated 12.5m pool, and concierge support for tastings, private chefs, and easy day trips to the Mediterranean.
